suite.name: pandas Example

kw.name: Set Index
kw.doc: Method to read the csv file and return the pandas dataframe.

test.name: Test read all content

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Read All Content
kw.doc: This get_message keyword "read_all_content" which will return the data of all rows and columns of the file specified as a argument
kw.msg: ${return_data} = first_name last_name email gender ip_address id 1 Douglas Morris dmorris0@mozilla.org Male ...

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

test.doc: Test to read all rows and columns from the data

test.name: Test read all rows

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Read All Rows
kw.doc: This get_message keyword "read_all_rows" which will return the data based on all the row datas and column names.
kw.msg: ${return_data} = id 1 Douglas 2 Stephanie 3 Russell 4 Helen 5 Jesse 6 Ashley 7 Rachel 8 Phillip 9 Craig 10 Patrick Name: first_name, dtype: object

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

test.doc: Test to read all rows from the data

test.name: Test read all column

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Convert To Integer
kw.doc: Converts the given item to an integer number.

kw.name: Read All Columns
kw.doc: This get_message keyword "read_all_columns" which will return the data based on row and all the column data.
kw.msg: ${return_data} = first_name Patrick last_name Fisher email pfisher9@1und1.de gender Male ip_address 2.36.191.97 Name: 10, dtype: object

kw.name: Log To Console
kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

test.doc: Test to read all columns from the data

kw.doc: Logs the given message to the console.

kw.name: Read Row And Column
kw.doc: This get_message keyword "read_row_and_column" which will return the data of particular rows and particular columns of the file specified as a argument.

kw.name: Get Row And Column Size
kw.doc: This get_message keyword "get_row_and_column_size" which will return the number of rows and columns present in the file

arguments.arg: Row size is ${row_size} and column size is ${column_size}
